thread.title: 3DS MAX MD5 exporter that works with multiple meshes

post.author: motorsep
post.body:
Is there any working MD5 exporters for MAX that would export scene that contains multiple meshes to MD5 files?
Der-Ton's exporter works fine for single mesh only
I have model that splited on pieces (body, helmet, face, shoulders pads, weapon, etc.) and it's already rigged and animated. I need to export it to MD5, but der_ton's exporter fails to do so And I can't have single mesh due to specific work flow.
Thanks.

post.author: 6th Venom
post.body:
I think there is another one that do it, but as far as i can remember, you can only export 1 standard material (no multi materials) with it, can't remember the name...

You should definitivly rework your model, just "attach" all members to the body, and reskin it to your animated bones.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Berserker's exporter is what you're looking for (linked to in the tools sticky thread in the Modeling&Animation subforum):
http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=4618

post.author: motorsep
post.body:
Thanks guys!

der_ton,
Can you general MD5 exporter export animated flag (cloth simulation in both MAX or/and Blender) to MD5 even if flag has no bones?

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
motorsep wrote:
Can you general MD5 exporter export animated flag (cloth simulation in both MAX or/and Blender) to MD5 even if flag has no bones?
